metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11213 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Adobe Flash Player 27.0.0.183 and earlierversions. This vulnerability occurs as a result of a computation that readsdata that is past the end of the target buffer due to an integer overflow;the computation is part of the abstraction that creates an arbitrarilysized transparent or opaque bitmap image. The use of an invalid(out-of-range) pointer offset during access of internal data structurefields causes the vulnerability. A successful attack can lead to sensitivedata exposure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 27.0.0.187ubuntu0.16.04.1
flashplugin-installer - 27.0.0.187ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '27.0.0.187ubuntu0.16.04.1').
